etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish آنغت (angıt), آنغیت (angıt), آنغد (angıd) or آنغید (angıd), from Proto-Turkic *āŋkït (“wild duck”), shares common origin with Mongolian ангир (angir). Cognates with Azerbaijani anqut, Chagatai انقوت (anḳut), انقور (anḳur), Karakhanid اَنْكِتْ (aŋıt, anɣıt), Kumyk гьанкъут (hanqut, “loon”), Kyrgyz аңыр (aŋır), Turkmen aňk, Uyghur ھاڭگىرت (hanggirt, “swan goose”), Uzbek angʻirt, Western Yugur aŋəht (aŋït), Yakut аҥыр (aŋïr).
